main.title: Gospellist
main.sub_title: Gospellist is a non-profit organization dedicated to developing and distributing Bible apps.

section1.title: Our Mission
text: Our mission is to create and share Bible apps that help seekers, non-believers, and believers around the world engage with Scripture daily. We believe that when people encounter God’s Word each day, lives are transformed.
To fulfill this mission, we have already built strong capabilities in Bible app development and are actively working on new projects to meet the needs of a global audience.

section2.title: Empowering Underprivileged Youth
text: We are also committed to training young people from underprivileged communities to become skilled app developers. By sharing our experience and knowledge in Bible app development, we provide these youth with real learning opportunities—and real work. They are not only trained but also given projects, enabling them to participate in app development and build a path toward economic self-reliance.

section3.title: Supporting Digital Evangelism Worldwide
text: Before founding this organization, our core members were already engaged in developing Bible apps and supporting digital evangelism teams in the Middle East. Now, we are expanding this work to support digital mission teams across the globe—providing tools, training, and spiritual resources to help them share the Gospel effectively in the digital age.

section4.title: We Do This Together—with Gospellists
text: We believe that this mission is carried out together with Gospellists from all walks of life:
Missionaries and Pastors who share the apps,
And Bible readers who live out the Word each day.

main.title: Bible app to be developed
main.sub_title: We are planning to develop a Bible app called Lumen365.
text: The idea for this new Bible app was born out of a recurring challenge in digital evangelism: many seekers and non-believers respond to online gospel ads and request a Bible—but soon disappear without receiving proper follow-up from evangelism teams.

In addition, in many regions, it is still uncommon for church members to read and meditate on the Bible daily. Our goal is to develop an app that both encourages and enables seekers and believers to engage with Scripture every day.

features.title: Fully Personalized Bible Reading Plans
features.desc: Tailored plans for individual users and churches, starting on chosen dates.

features.title: Pastor-Branded Commentary
features.desc: Daily commentary aligned with Protestant doctrine, editable or recordable by pastors, with options for anonymity in sensitive areas.

features.title: Automated Daily Content Delivery
features.desc: Mobile notifications deliver Scripture and commentary seamlessly each day.

features.title: Accessible Text and Audio Format
features.desc: Content available in text and audio, leveraging FCBH resources for global reach.

features.title: Questions and AI-Recommended Answers
features.desc: AI handles initial responses, linking apologetics content, with team oversight to ensure care and engagement.

features.title: Heart Tablet – A Personal Meditation Space
features.desc: Users save verses, write reflections, and keep a lifelong archive of spiritual journaling.

features.title: Real-Time Ministry Statistics
features.desc: Pastors and missionaries gain insights into user engagement for better discipleship and follow-up.
